title: I admit it...
author: JGray
text:
I admit, I wrote this page specifically to showcase Gennifer's talents for detail. She's done an amazing job on this page of breathing life into a post-apocolyptic landscape. This page really demonstrates how well she does with landscapes, with little things like the ragged edges of torn metal, and the decay of rust.

We've got some fun action coming up in the next few pages and before this story is done, Theresa will end up with a new toy!

replies.author: James Smith*Guest*
replies.text: Action and new toys?! This is why we come here (and possibly lesbian love, the hottest kind of all. Not really the point of the story, but it's there.)

replies.author: Xade*Guest*
replies.text: wonderful page, outstanding detail, she did an awesome job

replies.author: James Smith*Guest*
replies.text: I can see why you didn't choose my work. You wanted a better sense of epicness in the use of details, and I just haven't spent enough time on Photoshop to figure out any of it.

replies.author: Ayshara*Guest*
replies.text: Very nice page. I have to wonder, is the title for the page either a blatant hint for what comes next or just because you like that song (if not both)?

replies.author: JakeS*Guest*
replies.text:
Speaking of details, is William supposed to switch his sword from the left to the right hand between panels 1 and 2 and back again before panel 3?

- Jake
